intro: Glycydendron espiritosantense, commonly known as the Espirito Santo glycydendron, is a rare flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
